apollo.viz.date_heatmap¶

apollo.viz.date_heatmap(series, start=None, end=None, mean=False, edgecolor='black', ax=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Plot a calendar heatmap given a datetime series.

Parameters:
  • series (pd.Series) – A series of numeric values with a datetime index. The index is interpreted by pandas.to_datetime(). Values occurring on the same day are combined by sum.
  • start (Any) – The first day to be considered in the plot. The value is interpreted by pandas.to_datetime(). The default is the earliest date in the index.
  • end (Any) – The last day to be considered in the plot. The value is interpreted by pandas.to_datetime(). The default is the latest date in the index.
  • mean (bool) – Combine values occurring on the same day by mean instead of sum.
  • edgecolor (str) – The color of the edges that delineate months.
  • ax (matplotlib.axes.Axes or None) – The axes on which to draw the heatmap. The default is the current axes in the pyplot API.
  • **kwargs – Forwarded to pcolormesh() for drawing the heatmap.
Returns:

matplotlib.axes.Axes – The axes on which the heatmap was drawn. This is set as the current axes in the pyplot API.
